properties.name: server.extraHttpPort
properties.description: Used for listening on port 80 when the main port is 433 in a Production environment.

properties.name: server.redirectHttpToHttps
properties.description: Redirects http requests to https when true. Used to redirect port 80 requests to 433 in a Production environment.

properties.name: server.allowedOrigins
properties.description: Cross Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) allowed origins. Comma separated list of hosts. Allows HTML pages that didn't originate from the server to make WebSocket connections. Set to "*" or http://localhost:3000 for Development. For Production, don't set a value, so that only pages that originated from the server can make WebSocket connections.

properties.name: server.botsWebsite
properties.description: Redirect requests from any Bots to resources/static/bots/... when true.

properties.name: server.sessionsDirectory
properties.description: Directory for saving session data in case of a server re-start.

properties.name: database.password
properties.description: Database password or a system environment variable enclosed in ${ and }. e.g. {BRILL_DATABASE_PWD}

properties.name: brill.apps.repo
properties.description: Git repository containing configuration data for apps.

properties.name: brill.apps.local.repo.skip.pull
properties.description: Skip doing a repo pull on startup if true.

properties.name: passwords.pepper
properties.description: The pepper string is added to passwords. Changing this value will invalidate all existing passwords that use the pepper.

properties.name: passwords.allowClearText
properties.description: Set to true to allow clear text passwords to be set initially in the database. When the user changes their password, its always hashed. The default is false.

properties.name: log.sessions.to.db
properties.description: When set to true, session information and pages accesses are logged to the database tables session_log and session_page_log.

properties.name: logging.level.brill
properties.description: Set the log level to TRACE, DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR or FATAL. Set to TRACE to see the JSON messages exchanged between the server and clients.
